mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Eleanor Stuart to Tobias Lear, 1789 October 8
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Stuart, Eleanor Calvert Custis, approximately 1758-1811
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Eleanor Calvert Custis Stuart writes from Abingdon to Tobias Lear in New York. Has never allowed herself to join general cry against him--wishes Bett and Patt [Eliza and Martha Custis] could have same advantages as her other children--guests--a boating accident in front of her house. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, docketed by Lear. Name on original manuscript appears as "Eleanor Stuart." Date on original catalog card appears as "[1789] Oct. 8."
